Das Geosciences gehört zum Studienbereiche Geosciences der Fächergruppe Mathematics, Natural Sciences.Weitere Informationen zum Studienbereich Geosciences.Weitere Informationen zur Fächergruppe Mathematics, Natural Sciences.
                                                Geosciences

Target group:
The M.Sc. program 'Applied & Environmental Geoscience' (AEG) is an international research-oriented study program focusing on the evaluation and solution of environmental problems. Special emphasis is given to environmental problems in the subsurface such as the pollution of drinking water supplies from groundwater resources, the non-sustainable use of natural resources, the impact of short and long term waste disposal, the impact of climate and land-use change on soil and water quality.

The program aims for a comprehensive understanding of the physical, chemical, and biological process mechanisms in the geo- and hydrosphere. Students from various science backgrounds learn to qualitatively and quantitatively address complex processes in soils, water and air and to evaluate environmental risks based on multi-disciplinary approaches.
Annotation of the Higher Education Insti: Application deadline for foreign applicants is 31 March.

Target group:
Admission requirement for the master's program is a German or equivalent foreign qualification for a degree in German Philology, Romance Philology, English Philology, Slavic Philology, Dutch Philology, General and Comparative Literature or another neo-philology subject with a minimum of 60 credits, thereof at least 20 credits in the field of Literary Studies, or a cultural studies subject with a professional contribution from the field of Literary Studies of at least 20 credit points.
Applicants who have completed their studies at a foreign university or comparable institution must be able to prove their knowledge of German. This can be demonstrated by passing the German Language Examination for University Entrance (DSH) or by demonstrating an equivalent level of proficiency according to the Regulations for the German Language Examination for University Entrance of Foreign Applicants at Freie Universität Berlin.
